creditline: The Jane and James Emison Endowment for Native American Art
life_date: Winyan Hcaka ("The True Woman"), American (Oglala Lakota)
medium: Hide, glass and brass beads, dyed porcupine quills, cotton and polyester fabric, sinew
text: The overall design of the cape is a short half-circle shape style and open in the front. It has a light-colored hide body with red lining.  Across the cape many symmetrical beaded floral sprays and floral motifs in multicolored beads are the main design elements. The edging is an abstract pattern with white, red, blue, and yellow beads. Attached to this edging are short fringes on all edges including neckline that is wrapped in red porcupine quills.
title: Cape
